entries: Arskuva can't use reactions. If Helg issues a mental command as an action with the {@trait concentrate} trait, Arskuva can use 2 actions on her turn. Otherwise, she can use only 1 action to {@action Stride} or {@action Strike}.
top.name: Minion

entries: The swarm deals {@damage 4d6} piercing damage and {@damage 2d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} to every creature in its space ({@dc 29} basic Reflex save). The first time per round that a creature is affected by an aukashungi swarm's Burrowing Agony, the creature is also exposed to expeditious evolution.
bot.name: Burrowing Agony
Expeditious Evolution
bot.note: This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor the damage from it healed, until successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease.

stages.entry: The aukashungi swarm chooses two of the victim's ability modifiers.

entries: The brughadatch conjures a decadent, enticing feast void of nutritional substance. This conjuration takes 1 minute and lasts for 24 hours.
For each item of illusory food a creature eats, it must attempt a {@dc 29} Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature sees through the illusion and becomes immune to the effects of Deceitful Feast for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature doesn't see through the illusion but is unaffected by the food.
entries.Failure: The creature takes a –1 circumstance penalty to Will saves against any of the brughadatch's spells or abilities. The penalty increases with each failed save, to a maximum of –5.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, plus for 1 hour, the creature's attitude becomes {@condition helpful} to the brughadatch, and the creature can't use {@condition hostile} actions against them.

bot.name: Deceitful Feast

bot.requirements: Targets must have critically failed a save against a brughadatch's Deceitful Feast or charm innate spell
entries: The brughadatch feasts on the souls of the creatures they've tricked. They target up to five creatures within 30 feet and feast on their ambient brainpower, dealing {@damage 4d10} mental damage ({@dc 26} basic Will save) to each creature. Unless a target succeeds at the Will save, this damage does not end the charm effect or the effect of Deceitful Feast as a {@condition hostile} action normally would.
bot.name: Psychic Sip

mid.requirements: A doblagub has bonded with their current location by being called there via a ritual or by remaining in one place for 10 years
entries: 40 feet. ; The doblagub grows etheric fibers that they can use to psychically keep prey close. Any time a creature tries to move within this aura, it must succeed at a {@dc 30} Will save or the movement fails and the action is wasted.
mid.name: Etheric Fibers

entries: detect magic, produce flame; Constant (6th) true seeing.
bot.name: Cantrips

entries: Requirements The doblagub's etheric fibers aura is active; ; All nonbrughadatch creatures within the aura must succeed at a {@dc 30} Fortitude save or be pulled 10 feet toward the doblagub.
bot.name: Etheric Tug

entries: A doblagub can use their tongue to make spell attacks with spells that have a range of touch.
bot.name: Magical Tongue

entries: Medium, {@damage 4d10+8} bludgeoning, Rupture 24.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

abilities: one regional language (can't speak any language)

entries: When using their {@action Change Shape|LOAG} ability, the faceless butcher loses their alignment aura and thus cannot be detected by spells such as detect alignment.
top.name: Suppressed Alignment

entries: 10 feet, {@dc 26}. This aura is suppressed if the faceless butcher is using {@action Change Shape|LOAG}.
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: The faceless butcher can take on the exact form of any Small, Medium, or Large humanoid whose face they carry in their bag of faces, changing their shape and physical features to precisely match that of the victim whose face they wear. This doesn't change the butcher's.
bot.name: Change Shape

mid.trigger: The gahlepod becomes adjacent to at least one other gahlepod
entries: The gahlepod is spurred into a frenzy by the others. For the rest of the round, their jaws {@action Strike} deals {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} in addition to the listed damage.
mid.name: Churning Frenzy

entries: When flipped on its back, a giant aukashungi can't move and its soft underbelly becomes exposed. Whenever a creature critically succeeds at a melee attack roll to {@action Strike} a giant aukashungi, the attacking creature can forgo the bonus damage to flip over the giant aukashungi (all other critical hit effects apply normally, such as critical specialization effects). While flipped over, the giant aukashungi can't use reactions, can't {@action Stride} or {@action Strike}, takes a –2 circumstance penalty to AC and saving throws, loses its resistances, and gains weakness 10 to physical damage. The aukashungi can right itself by using the.
mid.name: Flippable

entries: Up activity and then using an action to unroll.
mid.name: Roll

entries: The giant aukashungi releases an acidic gas from its ventral glands in a 30-foot burst. Each creature that starts its turn in the area takes {@damage 10d8} acid damage plus {@damage 2d8} {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid damage} ({@dc 32} basic Fortitude save). The gas moves 10 feet away from the giant aukashungi each round and lasts for 1 minute.
The giant aukashungi can't use Acidic Effluence again for 1 minute.
bot.name: Acidic Effluence

entries: The aukashungi protects its soft underbelly by rolling into a tight ball.

The aukashungi gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC while Rolled Up, but it cannot {@action Stride} or {@action Strike}, and it rolls downhill if on a slope. If the aukashungi is grappling a creature when it.
bot.name: Roll Up

entries: Up, that creature must succeed at a {@dc 35} Fortitude save or become.
bot.name: Rolls

entries: The aukashungi can unroll with a single action (this action has the {@trait move} trait).
bot.name: Swallowed Whole.

entries: Large, {@damage 15d6+6} bludgeoning, Rupture 27.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: A harrow doll can cast {@spell augury} as part of a harrow reading, which takes the usual 10 minutes. When casting locate, the harrow doll doesn't need to have previously {@condition observed} a specific object to learn its direction, but instead can detail the direction only vaguely, using such phrases as "beside a weeping mound"
top.name: Uncanny Divination

entries: "beneath the lost sky." When the harrow doll casts mind reading, there is no effect if the target critically succeeds its save. Each time a harrow doll makes a harrow reading, it also changes which saving throw is affected by its fortune's favor ability.
If the suit of its latest harrow reading is unknown, roll {@dice 1d6} at the beginning of combat to randomly determine it.
mid.name: Crowns).

entries: A creature struck by one of the harrow doll's cards must attempt a {@dc 25} Will save or be cursed with misfortune, which forces the creature to roll twice and take the lower result on its next roll of a specific type, determined by the card's suit (roll {@dice 1d6} to randomly determine the suit). A creature can be cursed with only one effect from harrowing misfortune at a time, with a new curse overriding any previous curse. The curse ends after 1 minute or after the specified roll is made, whichever comes first. The suits and their effects are: Hammers (melee attack roll), Keys (Reflex save), Shields (Fortitude save), Books (skill check), Stars (Will save), and Crowns (spell attack roll).
bot.name: Harrowing Misfortune

entries: Despite her size, Helg's multiple joints allow her to fit through tight spaces as if she were a Medium creature. While {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}, she can move at her full Speed.
bot.name: Eerie Flexibility

bot.requirements: Helg's most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell
entries: Helg drains away the life force from a creature targeted by the spell, with a result depending on its Fortitude save ({@dc 36}). This effect is magical and can be counteracted with {@spell dispel magic} (Level 15, {@dc 36}). This ability cannot affect a creature that critically succeeded at the spell's saving throw, if any.

entries.Critical Failure: {@condition Fatigued}, and rest does not remove the creature's {@condition fatigued} condition for 1 week.

bot.name: Enervating Tug

entries: Helg makes up to three claw {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These attacks all count toward Helg's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after she makes all her attacks.
bot.name: Furious Claws

entries: claw
bot.name: Rend

entries: When Ledorick rolls a success on a Fortitude save, it is a critical success instead.
mid.name: Juggernaut

entries: Ledorick gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of his turns that he can use only for an Attack of Opportunity.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

mid.trigger: A creature within Ledorick's reach critically fails a {@action Strike} against him
entries: Ledorick makes a melee {@action Strike} against the triggering creature or attempts to {@action Disarm} the triggering creature.
mid.name: Dueling Riposte

bot.requirements: Ledorick has a single one-handed melee weapon in one hand and has his other hand free
entries: Ledorick gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of his next turn.
bot.name: Dueling Parry

bot.requirements: Ledorick has a single one-handed melee weapon in one hand and has his other hand free
entries: Ledorick {@action Strike||Strikes} with the required weapon. On a hit, he moves the target up to 10 feet into a space he can reach, even moving the target through his own space. On a failed {@action Strike}, Ledorick can still move the target 5 feet in this way. This action can be used only if Ledorick has a multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Guiding Finish

entries: When Ledorick can see and be seen by at least two allies, his attacks deal {@dice 3d6} extra precision damage.
bot.name: Show-Off

entries: Ledorick {@action Stride||Strides} twice and makes a melee {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Sudden Charge

entries: 30 feet, {@dc 33}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: Lyrt possesses a {@trait Large} or smaller object within 20 feet, making it an animated object (Bestiary 20)
This animated object's level can be no higher than Lyrt's level – 2. If the target object is being held by a creature, the bearer can attempt a Will save to prevent the possession.
This possession ends when the object is destroyed or Lyrt leaves it. At this point, Lyrt reappears in the object's square and can't Inhabit an Object again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Inhabit Object

entries: Lyrt attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature. This has the same effect as the {@spell possession} spell with an unlimited duration, except since Lyrt doesn't have a physical body, he is unaffected by that restriction. When Lyrt departs, the target has only {@condition confused} and incoherent memories of the period during which they were possessed. If a creature dies while possessed by Lyrt and its corpse remains intact, Lyrt can immediately inhabit the corpse (see Inhabit Object) as a reaction, in which case the corpse acts like an animated object.
bot.name: Malevolent Possession

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical

entries: Any creature that {@action Strike||Strikes} the qurashith with a melee weapon must attempt a {@dc 37} Reflex save. On a failure, the creature is disarmed of its weapon, which becomes stuck to the qurashith's body; if the {@action Strike} was an unarmed attack, the creature's limb sticks to the qurashith's body and the creature becomes {@condition immobilized}. A creature must succeed at a {@dc 31} {@skill Athletics} check to retrieve a stuck weapon. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage and the weapon remains stuck, and on a critical failure, the creature also becomes stuck to the qurashith and becomes {@condition immobilized}. A stuck creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage each round it remains stuck to the qurashith and can use an {@action Escape} action to try to free itself from the monster ({@dc 31}).
mid.name: Adhesive Body

entries: 90 feet, {@dc 33}
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: A creature that takes damage from a qurashith's jaws or spittle must succeed at a {@dc 39} Fortitude save or be {@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 1} for {@dice 1d4} rounds ({@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 2} on a critical failure). If a creature is already {@condition slowed} when it fails its save, it becomes {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.
bot.name: Paralytic Saliva

entries: The qurashith unleashes a debilitating psionic scream. Creatures in a 60-foot cone must succeed at a {@dc 35} Will save or become {@condition stupefied|CRB|stupefied 2} ({@condition stupefied|CRB|stupefied 4} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. A creature that critically succeeds at its Will save is immune to the qurashith's Psychic Howl for 24 hours. The qurashith can't use Psychic Howl again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Psychic Howl

entries: A sodden sentinel is permanently {@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Slow

entries: When a sodden sentinel is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it explodes, dealing {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage to each creature in a 10-foot emanation ({@dc 30} basic Reflex save). A creature that fails this save is also {@condition blinded} for {@dice 1d4} rounds (1 minute on a critical failure).
mid.name: Tainted Guts

entries: A sodden sentinel's fist {@action Strike} deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage to {@condition prone} creatures.
bot.name: Pummel the Fallen

entries: The sodden sentinel vomits up a supernaturally tainted wave of seawater in a 30-foot cone. Each living creature in the area takes {@damage 6d10} negative damage ({@dc 30} basic Reflex save). It can't use Seawater Retch again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Seawater Retch

entries: 60 feet. Any creature that ends its turn in the aura feels the intense pain of starvation and must attempt a {@dc 32} Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition fatigued} and takes {@dice 7d6} damage. The damage and fatigue a creature takes from this aura can't be healed until the affected creature has eaten a full meal.
mid.name: Starvation Aura

entries: The gashadokuro breathes a spray of bone shards in a 30-foot cone.
Each creature in the area takes {@damage 9d12} piercing damage ({@dc 36} basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: If the gashadokuro kills a creature with Swallow Whole, it immediately regains Hit Points equal to the swallowed creature's level. As long as the gashadokuro still exists, creatures consumed in this way can't be resurrected except by wish or a similarly powerful effect.
bot.name: Corpse Consumption

entries: Large, {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning, Rupture 26.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

creature.name: Stirvyn Banyan
items: Sheriff Banyan's map of the sea caves

mid.trigger: Stirvyn is targeted with an attack and is adjacent to an ally
entries: Stirvyn and the ally swap places, and the ally becomes the target of the attack.
mid.name: Duck Away

entries: When Stirvyn casts a bloodline spell, a surge of ancestral memories grants either him or a target of the spell a +1 status bonus to skill checks for 1 round.
bot.name: Bloodline Magic

entries: When Stirvyn {@action Casts a Spell} from a spell slot, if the spell deals damage and doesn't have a duration, he gains a status bonus to that spell's damage equal to the spell's level.
bot.name: Dangerous Sorcery

entries: If a reaction would disrupt Stirvyn's spellcasting action, he attempts a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
bot.name: Steady Spellcasting

entries: A tallow ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
top.name: Motion Sense

entries: Whenever the tallow ooze takes fire damage, it becomes {@condition quickened} for 1 round (it can only {@action Stride} or {@action Strike} with the extra action). Whenever the tallow ooze is dealt cold damage (even if that damage is prevented by its resistance), it becomes {@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 1} for 1 round and can't use its Engulf ability (but creatures already engulfed are still engulfed).
mid.name: Congealed

entries: 10 feet. Any creature that starts its turn in or enters a square in the area must attempt a {@dc 30} {@skill Acrobatics} check to {@action Balance}. A creature that takes a {@action Step} doesn't need to roll this check.
mid.name: Greasy Seepage

entries: {@dc 30}, {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning, {@action Escape} {@dc 26}, Rupture 25.
bot.name: Engulf

entries: When the tallow ooze critically succeeds at an attack against a creature or a creature escapes from being engulfed by the ooze, that creature's hands and gear become slick with grease. For {@dice 1d4} rounds, the affected creature must attempt a {@dc 30} Reflex save whenever it uses any item (including weapons) that must be wielded or held. On a failure, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to any attack roll or check to use the item; on a critical failure, the creature drops the item, which lands in a random adjacent square.
The creature (or an adjacent ally) can use 1 {@action Interact} action to wipe off the grease from an item or from its hands.
bot.name: Residual Grease

entries: Tashlock can move his full Speed when {@action Sneak||Sneaking}.
top.name: Swift Sneak

entries: Tashlock isn't {@condition flat-footed} to creatures of 12th level or lower that are {@condition hidden}, {@condition undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.
mid.name: Deny Advantage

mid.trigger: Tashlock is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker he can see
entries: Tashlock gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Nimble Dodge

entries: When Tashlock deals damage to a target on a critical hit, the target is {@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 2} until the end of Tashlock's next turn.
bot.name: Pierced Tendon

entries: Tashlock {@action Interact||Interacts} to draw a weapon, then {@action Strike||Strikes} with that weapon.
bot.name: Quick Draw

entries: Tashlock deals an extra {@damage 3d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: When Tashlock rolls a failure on a {@action Sneak} action, he gets a success instead.
bot.name: Sneak Savant

entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are {@condition flat-footed} to Tashlock.
bot.name: Surprise Attack

entries: The Vanish Man doesn't have an alignment aura and cannot be detected by spells such as {@spell detect alignment}.
top.name: Vanished Alignment

entries: 10 feet, {@dc 33}. This aura is suppressed while the Vanish Man is using Change Shape.
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: As faceless butcher (page 80).
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: As faceless butcher (page 80).
bot.name: Remove Face

entries: As faceless butcher (page 80).
bot.name: Sudden Slices

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+13} bludgeoning plus Push and punishing tail

mid.trigger: The war sauropelta would be affected by the {@condition immobilized}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, or {@condition stunned} conditions, or by an effect that would give it a penalty to its Speeds, from a source of 14th level or less
entries: The war sauropelta negates the triggering condition or effect.
mid.name: Dogged Persistence

entries: A creature struck by the war sauropelta's tail must attempt a {@dc 32} Fortitude save. On a failure, it's {@condition stunned|CRB|stunned 1}; on a critical failure, it's {@condition stunned|CRB|stunned 3}.
bot.name: Punishing Tail

entries: Medium or smaller, foot, {@dc 32}
bot.name: Trample

creature.name: Wight Cultist
items: platinum religious symbol of Bokrug worth 150 gp

mid.trigger: The wight cultist is reduced to 0 Hit Points
entries: The wight makes a {@action Strike} before being destroyed. It doesn't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this {@action Strike}. A creature hit by this {@action Strike} is also {@condition doomed|CRB|doomed 1} for 1 minute.
mid.name: Dreadful Spite

entries: When the wight damages a living creature with its claw or ranseur {@action Strike}, the wight gains 12 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a {@dc 29} Fortitude save or become {@condition drained|CRB|drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the wight increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of {@condition drained|CRB|drained 4}.
bot.name: Drain Life

entries: A living humanoid slain by a wight's claw or ranseur {@action Strike} rises as a wight after {@dice 1d4} rounds. This wight spawn is under the command of the wight that killed it. It doesn't have drain life or wight spawn and becomes {@condition clumsy|CRB|clumsy 2} for as long as it is a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains drain life and wight spawn, and is no longer {@condition clumsy}.
bot.name: Wight Spawn

entries: +25 Str +7, Dex +5, Con +6, Int +0, Wis +5
top.name: Survival

entries: A xilvirek can sense the presence of creatures with an Intelligence of at least –3. Creatures that have silenced their thoughts through magic or other means can potentially counteract this sense at the GM's discretion.
top.name: Psionic Scent

entries: 30 feet. A creature that begins its turn in the area must succeed at a {@dc 32} Will save or become {@condition fascinated} with the xilvirek. If the creature is already {@condition fascinated} by the xilvirek and fails its save, the creature is compelled to approach the xilvirek and allow itself to be {@condition grabbed}, which ends the fascination.
mid.name: Hypnotic Stench

entries: The xilvirek retches a small pool of debilitating, acrid bile onto itself. All creatures within 30 feet take {@damage 4d6} acid damage as they inhale the bile's noxious fumes ({@dc 32} basic Fortitude save; on a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened|CRB|sickened 1}, or {@condition sickened|CRB|sickened 2} on a critical failure). The xilvirek can't Disgorge Bile again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Disgorge Bile

entries: The xilvirek has two tentacles on its back that it can use to suck the life from its prey. A creature that starts its turn {@condition grabbed} by the xilvirek becomes {@condition drained|CRB|drained 1}, and the xilvirek regains 20 HP. The {@condition drained} value increases by 1 on each subsequent round that the creature starts its turn {@condition grabbed}, but the xilvirek doesn't regain additional HP from draining the same creature more than once per day.
bot.name: Feasting Tentacles

entries: 10 feet.

Whenever a gutrager is within another xulgath's stench aura, a fog appears around the gutrager; creatures in the fog (including the gutrager) can see as normal, but they are {@condition concealed} from creatures outside the fog.
Non-xulgaths that begin their turn in the fog take {@damage 2d6} acid damage.
Strong winds suppress this ability.
mid.name: Caustic Fog

entries: Requirements The gutrager has 45 or fewer HP; The gutrager compresses its gut and explodes in a burst of viscera, {@condition dying} instantly and dealing {@damage 8d8} acid damage to creatures and unattended objects in a 20-foot emanation centered on the gutrager ({@dc 31} basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Self-Detonate

entries: The gutrager propels its esophagus out of its body to deliver an acidic blow. It makes an unarmed {@action Strike} against a creature or unattended object within 30 feet with a +23 attack bonus. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6+8} bludgeoning plus {@damage 4d6} acid damage. On a critical hit, the target also takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid damage}. The gutrager is {@condition clumsy|CRB|clumsy 1} for 1 round as it re-coils its esophagus.
bot.name: Corrosive Kiss

creature.name: Xulgath Hardscale
items: necklace of bone and gems worth 100 gp

entries: A hardscale always has their shield raised as if they had used the {@action Raise a Shield} action, as long as they meet that action's requirements.
mid.name: Hardscale Shield Stance

entries: 30 feet. As xulgath herd-tender (page 10), but {@dc 32}.
mid.name: Powerful Stench

entries: If the hardscale has their shield raised, they can {@ability Shield Block} when an attack is made against an adjacent ally. If they do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of the hardscale.
mid.name: Shield Warden

mid.trigger: The hardscale uses the {@ability Shield Block} reaction, and the opponent that triggered {@ability Shield Block} is adjacent to the hardscale and is not more than one size larger than it
entries: The hardscale makes an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Shove} the opponent. This {@action Shove} doesn't increase the hardscale's multiple attack penalty. If they roll a critical failure, they get a failure instead. If they roll a success, they get a critical success instead.
mid.name: Aggressive Block

entries: At the beginning of each of their turns, the hardscale receives an additional reaction that they can use only for {@ability Shield Block}.
mid.name: Shield Block

entries: The hardscale deals an extra {@dice 1d8} damage with weapons with the {@trait shove} trait, and weapons with the {@trait shove} trait gain the deadly {@dice 2d8} trait when the hardscale uses them (both the extra weapon damage die and the {@trait deadly} trait have already been included in the hardscale's warhammer {@action Strike} above).
bot.name: Hammer Mastery

attacks.name: moderate alchemist's fire
attacks.damage: {@dice 2d8} plus 2 {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} and 2 fire {@trait splash} damage

mid.trigger: The herd-tender is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see
entries: The herd-tender gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Mounted Defense

entries: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a {@dc 26} Fortitude save.

On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened|CRB|sickened 2}, and on a critical failure, the creature is also {@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 1} for as long as it is {@condition sickened}. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute.
mid.name: Powerful Stench

entries: The xulgath attempts to {@action Command an Animal} on their mount, but instead of demanding a specific action such as {@action Stride} or {@action Strike}, the xulgath gives a general directive, such as to return to camp or to attack a small group the mount can see. The mount and the xulgath each retain 3 actions on their turns, but the mount doesn't change its general tactics until the xulgath uses Feral Directive or {@action Command an Animal} again.
bot.name: Feral Directive

entries: A mounted xulgath's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@dice 1d8} damage to creatures that aren't mounted.
bot.name: Mounted Superiority

mid.trigger: The roughrider is targeted with an attack from a creature they can see
entries: The roughrider's mount becomes the target of the attack instead. The roughrider must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check or they fall off their mount and land {@condition prone}. If the check is a critical failure, the roughrider also takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage in addition to the normal damage from the fall.
mid.name: Hasty Sacrifice

entries: 30 feet. As xulgath herd-tender (page 10), but {@dc 30}.
mid.name: Powerful Stench

entries: As xulgath herd-tender (page 10).
bot.name: Feral Directive

entries: A mounted roughrider's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@dice 1d10} damage to creatures that aren't mounted.
bot.name: Mounted Superiority

entries: Zashathal's disgust for cowardice is so powerful that he can detect the presence of {@condition frightened} creatures, even if he can't see them.
top.name: Coward Sense

entries: When Zashathal rolls a success on a Fortitude save, it is a critical success instead. Zashathal halves damage he takes from failing a Fortitude save.
mid.name: Fanatical Juggernaut

entries: 30 feet. As xulgath herd-tender (page 10), but {@dc 34}.
mid.name: Powerful Stench

bot.trigger: Zashathal hits a creature with a melee {@action Strike}
entries: Zashathal makes an Intimidate check to {@action Demoralize} the target creature. If the target creature was reduced to 0 Hit Points by the triggering {@action Strike}, Zashathal can instead {@action Demoralize} all opponents within 30 feet by comparing the result of his {@skill Intimidation} check to each creature's Will DC. Zashathal doesn't take a penalty to these {@skill Intimidation} checks for not speaking a target's language.
bot.name: Intimidating Strike

entries: Zashathal gains 20 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, he deals 12 additional damage with melee attacks and takes a –1 penalty to AC. Zashathal can't use concentrate actions except {@action Seek} and rage actions. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies Zashathal can perceive, or until Zashathal falls {@condition unconscious}. Once the rage ends, Zashathal can't {@action Rage} again for 1 minute.
bot.name: Rage

entries: Zashathal gains 12 temporary Hit Points.
bot.name: Renewed Vigor

entries: Zashathal {@action Stride||Strides} twice and makes a melee {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Sudden Charge

entries: Zashathal makes a melee {@action Strike} against all creatures within his reach. Each attack counts toward his multiple attack penalty, but his multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until he's made all his attacks.
bot.name: Whirlwind Strike
